notes:
Please my friend relax. We have time. Planning is most important in any campaign. Had the dummkopf in Berlin only made more time for plans I would now be sitting in a luxury penthouse in Moscow drinking schnapps and fraternizing with Ukranian peasant girls.

I am anxiety like you to consumate our relationship, but we must be careful. You young people are so much in hurries.

Please give me another story to send, like I am the uncle of Mr Pederast, or perhaps his maternal grandfather. Easy, nicht wahr?

Wanting to hear about you.

Yours,

H. S.

Yes, Mr Abu, we are VERY close to the finishing off this transaction. But it is YOU who will make it finish at an unprofitabble place!

I have by cleverness of subterfuge put off the Barrister, sending him informations which is in my native tongue. Should he wish to make translation of my missive he will discover it is only my native German translation of the song "Mairzy Doats" and be in much confusion. Now to you, sir.

You have with much deliberateness ignored my requests for additional informations regarding Mr Peters, and with much laxative failed to read the Barrister's message to me. This transaction is very VERY BIG! We are not stealing pennines from grandmothers pocket book, but $16.8M dollars US! Do you think they will be such fools as to say, "Oh, Mr 96 Years of Age Man, you say you are the nephew of this very young man so it must be so, so here, have his money." Not bloody likely! I have gone so far with you in what you and I must know is criminal activities because the reward of such undertakings is large, but so is the riskyness of it all. We, if caught, will not be sent to our homes with stern warnings - we will be sent to a jail where we will become the boy toy pets of tattooed gangstas! Mark my words.

If you wish to my continuance, do the following and do them quickly:
1.) Send me the informations asked for about Mr Richard. How old was his age upon death? Where he live? and the like.
2.) Send me the informations the Barrister Prince has wanted, the like being Letter of Affidavid from the Court, the Death Certificate, and the Legality Certificate.
3.) Other covering informations.

If I see such in my computer mail soon, I will know we are going to be partners - and RICH PARTNERS at that. If I see nothing, well, this entire incidences with just be water off my back.

Please write soon.

Yours,

H. S.

messages.body:
Thank you very much, Mr. Abu, for contacting me. This transaction sounds very interesting, but I have a couple of questions:

1.) Why was I chosen? I do not wish to, as they say, "look down the gift horse's throat", but would like to know why I am so lucky.

2.) How did you know I was a foreigner? I have been in this country since 50 years. My fatherland is Germany, then I spent some time in Russia, followed by several years in Spandau then Argentina. Finally, Helga and I arrived here in the United States where I became a citizen along with her in a ceremony conducted on the White House lawn by Herr Nixon, the then leader. Pardon me if I ramble a bit, but Helga's passing away last year makes me anxious to speak of her.

Also, I did not receive your passport - I just began using computerized mail since Dear Helga passed, so perhaps it was missed by me on how to open it?

The informations you need are as follows:

Name: Harold Stassen
Address: 6214 East 47th Street

Suite 69
Phone: I have none - I have been deaf since 1945 from a military injury. Helga used to use the phone for me, but I took it out when she passed away.
Company: None/Retired
Occupation: Retired Military/Investments

I hope this helps you. Please tell me what to do next.

Yours,

H. S.

Yours,

H. S.

messages.subject: GOOD NEWS(URGENT REPLY PLEASE)
messages.body:
Dear Beloved Harold Stassen,

I am so happy to let you know that I have already forwarded your Bank to the account Department in regard to the transfer, Your Information was registered down and they are awaiting further documentation for proceedings from us.I tried also to call you this morning but your line was not going,I will try again later today.

Please know that for us to successfully execute the transaction. We Must need the services of a OCEANIC BANK INTERNATIONAL NIGERIA PLC accredited Attorney who will represent you in filling required applications and other required documents to the bank so that the bank will give an approval, recognizing you as the next of kin of the late Mr. Richard Peterson.

This approval automatically makes you the sole beneficiary to his account balance with the OCEANIC BANK INTERNATIONAL PLC OF NIGERIA.The money will be then released and transfer to your own bank account,after which I will also come over to meet with you personally for the sharing according to our agrees ratio.

Please, you must not let this Attorney know that I have any personal interest in this transaction. However, any document/proof demanded by the Attorney, all you should do is to let me know, I will advise you on what to do on each step.

Here is the Name and Email address of the OCEANIC BANK INTERNATIONALPLC OF NIGERIA Accredited Attorney:
Attorney Name : 
Attorney E-mail : barristeradams44@yahoo.com
I have draft an a note bellow which you need to send to the Attorney, Please let me know immediately you have sent the information below to the Attorney and I am waiting to hear from you after you must have read this email. Concerning the proof that you are a relative/next of kin to the late Mr. Richard Peterson, I am in charge of the investigations department in my bank do not worry I will take care of that ok.

Sincerely yours,

Mr.Abu Marwa.

Below is a draft of what you should send to the Attorney,

Attn : Barrister Prince Adams.
Dear Sir,

I am Harold Stassen,maternal relative of late Mr.Richard Peterson withAccount Number : 00111 674 00231 with the OCEANIC INTERNATIONAL BANKNIGERIA PLC .

Due to my busy schedule I will not afford the time to come to Nigeriafor the purpose of this transaction. I therefore request you to represent me as the Next of kin of late Mr.Richard Peterson to claim my late Uncle's fund that he left with the oceanic bank international plc at the time of his death .Please do get back to me on what next to do.

Thank you for your anticipated co-operation as I wait. for your response.

Yours Sincerely,

Harold Stassen.

messages.body:
Dear Freund Abu:

While I deeply appreciate your strenuous efforts on my behind, your letter (replicated bellow) has fill me with consern.

You say you called me. I told you I do not have a telephone. I am deaf since 1945 when taking aim with a panzerfaust at a Bolshevik tank moving along the Alexanderplatz and the panzerfaust ejaculated prematurely, rupturing my ear drums.  Helga, my dear, dead, departed wife, used to do my telephoneing for me, but since she departed recently I removed the telephone and have just so recently adopted computerized mail as my select form of communications.

Also, you wish me to say the departed Mr Pederast is my departed uncle. And I at age 96! Who would believe such a thing? Not that I am 96, but that I have a uncle who would be much older.

I know you are a kind man. Your picture tells me so. Dear, departed Helga had hobbies of phrenology, the study of heads and stuff, to tell people's character, and some of it rubbed off on me and I see you are good. I worry that you are 1.) perhaps new at your job and got it through connexions. Please do not be offended! I wish to help. We had such a man with us outside Smolensk in 1942 - he was the nephew of Grossadmiral Karl Doenitz. Duncan made bloody messes of the very simpler of thing, even patrol! He had his rank because of his uncle. Dear man that he was, we did not trust him but could not do nothing because of his high connexions. His luck was good, though, and he survived the war, moving to Pakistan to open his eponymous pastry shoppe. I do not think it, but if you ARE the son or something of someone high, rethink your career path. 2.) You are most likely overworked and allowing your subordinate untermensch to do your work for you. This is what I feel is happening - and I warn you, as a man who has lead other men into battle, this can be disasterous! Your overwork may require you to take some restful holiday when our transactions are consumated - I find the Wisconsin Dells a wonderful place to relax, boat, ski, drink beer with gnadige fraulein - you know the rest! Please take this to heart.

Please reply to me very soonest you are able to reply. We must have a better idea than I am somebodys 96 years nephew.

Yours,

H. S.

messages.subject: My Dear Beloved Harold Stassen
messages.body:
My Dear Beloved Harold Stassen,

Thanks so much for your mail,I am also very grateful to you on your advice,I have been working too much recently and it is truly affecting my composion.

Immediately after this transaction I will take a rest if possible resign from the Banking job.I ask that you please try all you can to contact the barrister,send him the draft I ask you to send to him on my previous mail,It is through him the Bank will respond in the completion of this transaction.

I am looking at us getting all roundup this very next week.I await to read from you.Please is important you send that draft to the Barrister for proceeding.

Looking Forward in seeing you soon.

Best Regards,

Mr.Abu Marwa.

messages.body:
My friend Mr Abu:

Please, please slow down. Your overbusyness in your job and perhaps the vision of our forthcoming profits are making you forgetful and careless. Jog your memory banks and reread my last message. I am 96 years old of age! I cannot have an uncle! Not at my 96 years of age! I did have one uncle who departed many, many years ago. I am enclosing his photograph - the only one of him I do have at my dear departed Helga's and my wedding in 1941. He is the one standing with the bumbershoot in front on the right. What age do you think he would have now? 116?

messages.body:
To Barrister Prince Adams




Herr: es ist Zeit. Der Sommer war sehr groß.
Leg deinen Schatten auf die Sonnenuhren,
und auf den Fluren laß die Winde los.

Befiel den letzten Früchten voll zu sein;
gib ihnen noch zwei südlichere Tage,
dränge sie zur Vollendung hin und jage
die letzte Süße in den schweren Wein.

Wer jetzt kein Haus hat, baut sich keines mehr.
Wer jetzt allein ist, wird Es lange bleiben,
wird wachen, lesen, lange Briefe schreiben
und wird in den Alleen hin und her
unruhig wandern, wenn die Blätter treiben.

Yours,

H. S.

Im Ligusterweg Nummer 4 war mal wieder bereits beim Frühstück Streit ausgebrochen.
Diese Narbe machte Harry sogar in der Welt der Zauberer zu etwas ganz Besonderem.
Gut - ich fahr in die Stadt und hol die Smokings für mich und Dudley ab.«
Tante Petunia, knochig und pferdegesichtig, wirbelte herum und schaute konzentriert aus dem Küchenfenster.
Harry wusste genau, dass Dudley Tante Magdas Umarmungen nur ertrug, weil er dafür gut bezahlt wurde.
Mir ist er immer schräg vorgekommen«, verkündete sie nach dem vierten Glas Sherry den begierig lauschenden Dörflern.
Da ein Mord an den Riddles nicht zu beweisen war, musste die Polizei Frank laufen lassen.

Seine,

H. S.

messages.body:
Mr Barrister:

Thank you for your splendid computer mail. I have read it, and the other one you send some days with the bank document. You will make pardons with me perhaps, sir, but I am an old man and have survived by trusting my deep feelings. The recordings I have in my possession show that Mr Pederast died leaving an estate in excess of $16M dollars USD. Yet you say me, and I am making quoting:

"The Bank stated that the Whole $14.2million can not be transfer at once today."

This has raised the red flag with me, and when I tell you my history you will see I am a man who does not like red flags. When I do math on these numbers, I find that $2.6M dollars USD are gone! Does my picture get to you? Where have the additional fundings gone?

I have the documents you have requested and will forward them to your chambers when I am satisfied that the sum of dollars we are discussing equals the sum I am expecting.

Please let me hear from you soon. And again I must beg pardons of you if it seems that I am a cranky old man. I have not had good experiences with barristers. I hope I am wrong in this current case.

Yours,

H. S.

Mr Barrister Adams,

I beg you to indulge me for making you wait so salaciously for me to write. Bless you.

As I have said, right now, at this moment, I have had much out of the pocket unexpected expense, so much that for the time being I will be living on canned foods. You wish us to hurry, and I am sure you wish to clear your docket, and I agree this is a good thing to do, but right now I will not be able to get you the money which you needs because of unexpected expense and need to buy food and rent.

As you well yourself know, soon I will have in my possessions $7.1Million dollars of the elusive spondulix and will be willing to increment your fees to twice what you now ask if you will humbly spot me the $1500. I can read from your mails that you are a good man - I hope you can read that I am just like you are. Do this and we will have the money we need for ourselves and all will be well.

If this is not unacceptable for you, then I ask that you do other things until my pension will come in, or until after April 20th when I will have many Reichsmarks to pay all the fees I currently need to pay.

The tennis ball is there for you to hit.

Yours,

H. S.

I assure the barrister considers my offer of ten times his fees - right now he sits and cackles to himself in his chambers, rubbing his greedy barrister hands thinking to himself "I will make MORE money from Harold." Relax and refresh youself today and Sunday, my friend. All will be well.

Yours,

H. S.
